original: Ålander, Anton Knut Gotthard, arkitekt, Göteborg, f. 5/5/92 i Blidsberg, Älvsb. 1., av kontr :prost. W. Å. o. Anna Littorin. G. 23 m. Greta Bogren. Barn: Lars f. 25, Sven 29, Ann 43. — CTI 15, KTH 16. Stud:res. t. Tyskl., Engl. o. Frankr. 12-26. Anst. h. arkit. Karl M. Bengtson i Gbg 16-20, egen arkit:verks, i Gbg sed. 20. Fd. led. av kyrkofullm, i Örgryte förs. Suppl. i Gbgs byggn:nd, stadsarkit. i Mariestad. Utf. ritn. t. sjukh., tingshus, stadshus, banker, ålderdomshem o. yrkessk. i Gbg m. fl. städer. Erh. ett flert. första pris i arkit :tävl. RVO.
translated: Ålander, Anton Knut Gotthard, architect, Gothenburg, b. 5/5/92 in Blidsberg, Älvsborg. Son of the late reverend W. Å. and Anna Littorin. Married on 23rd of (unknown month) to Greta Bogren. Children: Lars b. 25, Sven b. 29, Ann b. 43. Began studies at CTI in 1915, then at KTH in 1916. Studied abroad in Germany, England, and France from 1912-1926. Employed by architect Karl M. Bengtson in Gothenburg from 1916-1920, then established own architectural firm in Gothenburg since 1920. Former member of the church council in Örgryte parish. Acting architect in the Gothenburg building committee, city architect in Mariestad. Created designs for hospitals, courthouses, town halls, banks, nursing homes, and vocational schools in Gothenburg and other cities. Received multiple first prizes in architectural competitions. Awarded the Royal Order of Vasa.
